args.natural_language_statement: Suppose z0 ∈ ℂ. Show that lim_{z→z0} f(z) = ∞ in the sense of the Riemann sphere iff for every M > 0 there exists δ > 0 such that |f(z)| > M whenever |z - z0| < δ. Translate into Lean4 code (statement only, ends with := by sorry). Use Mathlib. Express the left side as: tendsto (fun z => |f z|) (nhds z0) at_top. Provide the lemma as an iff between that tendsto and the epsilon-delta formulation. Use proper naming conventions.

retrieved_examples.nl: If f : ℂ → ℂ and z₀ ∈ ℂ, lim_{z→z₀} f(z) = L iff for all ε>0 there exists δ>0 such that |f(z)-L|<ε whenever |z-z₀|<δ.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

theorem complex_limit_iff_eps_delta {f : Complex → Complex} {z0 L : Complex} :
  Tendsto (fun z => f z) (nhds z0) (nhds L) ↔
  ∀ ε : ℝ, ε > 0 → ∃ δ : ℝ, δ > 0 ∧ ∀ z : Complex, |z - z0| < δ → |f z - L| < ε := by sorry

{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Complex
open Filter

/-- Suppose z0 ∈ ℂ. Show that lim_{z→z0} f(z) = ∞ in the sense of the Riemann sphere iff for every M > 0 there exists δ > 0 such that |f(z)| > M whenever |z - z0| < δ. Translate into Lean4 code (statement only, ends with := by sorry). Use Mathlib. Express the left side as: tendsto (fun z => |f z|) (nhds z0) at_top. Provide the lemma as an iff between that tendsto and the epsilon-delta formulation. Use proper naming co

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Complex Filter

/-- Suppose z0 ∈ ℂ. Show that lim_{z→z0} f(z) = ∞ in the sense of the Riemann sphere iff for every M > 0 there exists δ > 0 such that |f(z)| > M whenever |z - z0| < δ. -/
theorem tendsto_riemann_sphere_at_top_iff {f : Complex → Complex} {z0 : Complex} :
  Tendsto (fun z => abs (f z)) (nhds z0) atTop ↔
  ∀ M : ℝ, M > 0 → ∃ δ : ℝ, δ > 0 ∧ ∀ z : Complex, abs (z - z0) < δ → abs (f z) > M := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Complex Filter

/-- Suppose z0 ∈ ℂ. Show that lim_{z→z0} f(z) = ∞ in the sense of the Riemann sphere iff for every M > 0 there exists δ > 0 such that |f(z)| > M whenever |z - z0| < δ. -/
theorem tendsto_riemann_sphere_at_top_iff {f : Complex → Complex} {z0 : Complex} :
  Tendsto (fun z : Complex => Complex.abs (f z)) (Filter.nhds z0) (Filter.atTop : Filter ℝ) ↔
  ∀ M : ℝ, M > 0 → ∃ δ : ℝ, δ > 0 ∧ ∀ z : Complex, Complex.abs (z - z0) < δ → Complex.abs (f z) > M := by sorry

args.query: Tendsto (fun z => ||f z||) nhds at_top complex norm Mathlib

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Complex Filter

/-- Suppose z0 ∈ ℂ. Show that lim_{z→z0} f(z) = ∞ in the sense of the Riemann sphere iff for every M > 0 there exists δ > 0 such that |f(z)| > M whenever |z - z0| < δ. -/
theorem tendsto_riemann_sphere_at_top_iff {f : Complex → Complex} {z0 : Complex} :
  Tendsto (fun z => (f z).abs) (nhds z0) atTop ↔
  ∀ M : ℝ, M > 0 → ∃ δ : ℝ, δ > 0 ∧ ∀ z : Complex, (z - z0).abs < δ → (f z).abs > M := by sorry

result:

 [{"severity": "info",
   "pos": {"line": 3, "column": 0},
   "endPos": {"line": 3, "column": 6},

 "env": 0}", "stderr": ""}

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Filter

/-- Suppose z0 ∈ ℂ. Show that lim_{z→z0} f(z) = ∞ in the sense of the Riemann sphere iff for every M > 0 there exists δ > 0 such that ‖f(z)‖ > M whenever ‖z - z0‖ < δ. -/
theorem tendsto_riemann_sphere_at_top_iff {f : ℂ → ℂ} {z0 : ℂ} :
  Tendsto (fun z => Norm.norm (f z)) (nhds z0) atTop ↔
  ∀ M : ℝ, M > 0 → ∃ δ : ℝ, δ > 0 ∧ ∀ z : ℂ, Norm.norm (z - z0) < δ → Norm.norm (f z) > M := by sorry
